# Draft:Persecution of Sufis in the Ottoman Empire (1669-1685)

Persecution of Sufis in the Ottoman empire (1669-1685) occurred during when the Kadizadeli was dominant in the courts of the Ottoman Empire and was supported by the Köprülüzade Fazıl Ahmed Pasha and the Sultan Mehmed IV.the Köprülüzade Fazıl Ahmed Pasha had given the Sultan attention of Vani Mehmet Efendi, a Kadizadeli, who he had been railing against Sufi lodges and tombs already.
Background
In the 17th century, there were a lot of changes made to the Ottoman Empire and a lot of reformist groups had popped up. One of these groups was the Kadizadeli, based off of the beliefs of Kadızade Mehmed Effendi,Muhammad Birgivi Effendi, Ibn Taymiyyah and Ibn Qayyim al-Jawziyya. They had been preaching in mosques, such as Hagia Sophia, during the reign of Sultan Murad IV.
